item.title: Wild Free-Roaming Horses and Burros Sale and Adoption Act of 2005

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Forests and Forest Health.

item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. (text of measure as introduced: CR S6832-6833)
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S6832)

summary.text: Wild Free-Roaming Horses and Burros Sale and Adoption Act of 2005 - Provides, with respect to the protection, management, and control of wild free-roaming horses and burros on public lands, for: (1) removing the limitation on the number of animals that may be adopted; and (2) the sale of excess wild free-roaming horses and burros for which an adoption demand by qualified individuals does not exist. Sets a $25 minimum adoption fee required for the adoption of an excess animal.

bill.title: Wild Free-Roaming Horses and Burros Sale and Adoption Act of 2005

item.title: Wild Free-Roaming Horses and Burros Sale and Adoption Act of 2005
Wild Free-Roaming Horses and Burros Sale and Adoption Act of 2005
A bill to provide for the sale and adoption of excess wild free-roaming horses and burros.

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. (text of measure as introduced: CR S6832-6833)

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
